metadata.title: CVE-2018-18493 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
A buffer overflow can occur in the Skia library during buffer offsetcalculations with hardware accelerated canvas 2D actions due to the use of32-bit calculations instead of 64-bit. This results in a potentiallyexploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 60.4, FirefoxESR < 60.4, and Firefox < 64.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-18493` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 64.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 64.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 64.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 64.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-testsuite - 1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '64.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
thunderbird package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
